title: As Trump Quits UNESCO, China Expands Influence
summary: Washington had been a buffer against China’s efforts to use UNESCO to influence education, historical designations and even artificial intelligence.

title: What to Know About the U.S. Move to Withdraw From UNESCO
summary: The Trump administration plans to pull out of the U.N. cultural agency, putting UNESCO back at the center of geopolitical rivalry.

title: Chinese Hackers Are Exploiting Flaws in Widely Used Software, Microsoft Says
summary: The company said state-backed hacking groups were breaching systems through flaws in SharePoint, which is used by the U.S. government and companies around the world.

title: Trump Accuses Obama of Treason, and Transgender Youth Clinics Close
summary: Plus, Ozzy Osbourne’s wild life.

title: Officials in Iran Suspect Sabotage in Wave of Fires and Explosions
summary: For weeks, fires and explosions have been reported almost daily in Iran. Officials are investigating what they think is a coordinated campaign.

title: Behind Japan’s Trade Deal: 8 Rounds of Talks and ‘Hurrying Slowly’
summary: After months of fraught negotiations with the United States, Japan clinched a deal just days before punitive tariffs were scheduled to take effect.

title: U.S. and Japan Reach Trade Deal
summary: President Trump said on Tuesday that the trade deal he struck with one of America’s closest allies would impose a 15 percent tariff on Japanese exports.

title: Canada Won’t Accept a Trade Deal With the U.S. at ‘Any Cost’
summary: Prime Minister Mark Carney, after a meeting with Canada’s political leaders, downplayed the chances of success in talks aimed at reaching a trade deal with President Trump.

title: Republicans Rely on Trump’s Promises to Grease the Path for His Agenda
summary: G.O.P. leaders scrounging for the votes to push through the president’s priorities have increasingly turned to him and his team to win over holdouts with special carve-outs and commitments.

title: Trump Baselessly Accuses Obama of ‘Treason’ as Questions Swirl About Epstein
summary: President Trump deflected questions about the disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein by lashing out at his perceived enemies.

title: Ozzy Osbourne’s Style Influenced Heavy Metal for Decades
summary: Osbourne and Black Sabbath pioneered a horror-inspired heavy metal look that was an alternative to the colorful tie-dye of the hippies, and a prototype of things to come.

title: On ‘The Osbournes,’ Ozzy Osbourne Became the Most Unlikely Relatable Reality TV Dad
summary: “The Osbournes” turned the heavy metal innovator into a reality TV star. Here are some moments that defined the show’s run.

title: Ozzy Osbourne: A Life in Pictures
summary: He pioneered heavy metal, became an unlikely reality TV star and performed a colossal final concert two weeks before his death.

title: Ozzy Osbourne, Black Sabbath Lead Singer Turned Reality TV Star, Dies at 76
summary: As the lead singer of Black Sabbath, he helped invent heavy metal. On “The Osbournes,” he presented a comedic counterpoint to his rock ’n’ roll infamy.

title: Aid Groups Blame Israel’s Siege of Gaza for ‘Mass Starvation’
summary: More than 100 organizations, including Save the Children and Doctors Without Borders, add to growing calls for aid restrictions to be eased and the war to end.

title: With Russia and Ukraine to Meet Again, Here’s What to Know About the Peace Talks
summary: The warring sides are still far apart heading into the third round of U.S.-brokered peace negotiations, set for Wednesday in Istanbul.

title: Zelensky Faces Criticism in Ukraine Over Effort to Rein In Corruption Agencies
summary: President Volodymyr Zelensky signed a bill limiting two Ukrainian agencies leading efforts against corruption. Critics say it was an overstepping of his authority.

title: Mamdani Victory Could Represent Expansion of the Left’s Influence
summary: Business leaders are anxious over the prospect of Zohran Mamdani in City Hall, while the Democratic Socialists of America are contemplating how they would wield power and influence policy.

title: Comeback in ’90s Offers Democrats a Bit of Hope. But Not Much.
summary: The party’s last rebuilding effort took nearly a decade and followed debilitating ideological battles. Some in the party see it as a model, up to a point.

title: Lawler Will Seek Re-election to House, Forgoing Run for N.Y. Governor
summary: Representative Mike Lawler’s decision clears a path for his Republican House colleague, Elise Stefanik, to challenge Gov. Kathy Hochul.

title: A Minnesota Mamdani? A Race for Mayor Has Echoes, but Only So Far.
summary: Omar Fateh, a young democratic socialist, beat out an establishment Democrat for the party’s endorsement in Minneapolis. But the parallels with Zohran Mamdani in New York might end there.

title: Bryan Kohberger to Be Sentenced in Killing of 4 Idaho Students
summary: The students’ families will have an opportunity to address the court, and many hope for answers to one major question about the brutal case: What was the motive?

title: A New Golf Course and Old Grudges Await Trump in Scotland
summary: Many Scots refuse to make peace with President Trump or his golf resorts, even after he deepened his investment in the land where his mother was born.

title: What if Everything We Know About Sacagawea Is Wrong?
summary: A growing body of evidence suggests she might have survived into old age — which would entirely change the story of America’s most iconic Native forebear.

title: Grizzlies Were Raiding Montana Farms. Then Came Some Formidable Dogs.
summary: Bears have recently acquired a fondness for the good eating found around grain bins on Montana’s plains. That’s a big problem for humans and grizzlies alike.

title: At Some Bookstores, Pets Are the Most Popular Sales Associates
summary: At shops across the country, some of the most popular sales associates have four legs, twitchy ears and whiskers.

title: I Watched It Happen in Hungary. Now It’s Happening Here.
summary: The real danger of a strongman isn’t his tactics; it’s how others, especially those with power, justify their acquiescence.

title: No, Israel Is Not Committing Genocide in Gaza
summary: The charge isn’t only obscene. It’s also absurd.

title: Democrats in the Wilderness
summary: We look at the state of the Democratic Party.

title: Late Night Watches Trump Try to Change the Subject From Epstein
summary: The president’s usual tactic when cornered is to “throw red meat to the carnivorous base — and their favorite cut is filet of Obama,” Stephen Colbert said.

title: Britain Moves to Curb Migrant Trafficking, and Ease Anger at Home
summary: Officials tried to ease public anger by penalizing networks run by gangs and organized crime. Experts and critics say the actions are unlikely to make much impact.

title: Louis Vuitton Netherlands Entangled in Money-Laundering Case
summary: A customer’s cash purchases of luxury goods totaling millions of euros in value caught the attention of prosecutors, who say the company should have noticed.
